page.title: 18ALUM BAY SANDS / NEEDLES
page.content: The Alum Bay sands were formed by the stones and shells from millions of years ago and by the tide they got washed into the shore.Because the cliff was there they could not push into it, so they built their way up and made coloured sands from the different minerals. THE NEEDLES Once there was a fourth rock at the Needles,but the tide crumbled it away.Now it is under the sea.The Needles used to have a lighthouse on the cliffs at Scratchells Bay but it got knocked down.It was wooden.At the wooden lighthouse,the keeper got thrown over the cliffs by smugglers. The new lighthouse is based on granite,the granite is too hard to be washed away. Ben Sklaroff. 9 years
